entry.title: This journey into ferret-obsession started something like 7 or 8 years ago. In that time, a little Instagram was born that grew ...
entry.summary: This journey into ferret-obsession started something like 7 or 8 years ago. In that time, a little Instagram was born that grew into a community of lovely, crazy, awesome ferret owners looking for a place to learn and support one another. Now we've got a Youtube channel and a website and amazing t-shirt designs! It's crazy how fast time goes! I hope each of you finds the courage to pursue something that brings you joy. #ferret #ferrets #ferretsofinstagram(Feed generated with FetchRSS)

entry.title: @oxbowanimalhealth Exciting news! Elijah will be participating in the #oxbowsponsored Oxbow Obies this year! I'm just providing ...
entry.summary: @oxbowanimalhealth Exciting news! Elijah will be participating in the #oxbowsponsored Oxbow Obies this year! I'm just providing sneaky hints for now (you'll learn more in the coming week), but for now I'll just say there's some awesome famous ferrets participating, and we get to have a little friendly competition for some really great prizes! Stay tuned everyone! #ferret #ferrets #oxbowobies(Feed generated with FetchRSS)

entry.title: Here are some symptoms of a common ferret illness called Adrenal Disease (referenced in Ferrets for Dummies). Check if your ferr...
entry.summary: Here are some symptoms of a common ferret illness called Adrenal Disease (referenced in Ferrets for Dummies). Check if your ferret exhibits any of these: Hair loss on tail (rat tail) Full body hair loss (if left untreated) Excessive itchiness Swollen vulva in spayed female ferrets Humping other ferrets Aggressive behavior Difficulty peeing Anemia in females Muscle thinning(Feed generated with FetchRSS)

entry.title: QUESTION: Can some of you provide me with some info for an upcoming video? I have my own numbers I'll provide but I'd like to ge...
entry.summary: QUESTION: Can some of you provide me with some info for an upcoming video? I have my own numbers I'll provide but I'd like to get some community feedback on the overall cost of ferrets so possible new owners can be prepared: What have been your costs for: -your ferrets themselves (and where you got them) -cage -accessories -food per month/ treats -unexpected vet bills (if you can post pictures of the bills, and any pics of procedure done, that would be awesome!!) -expected vet bills (vaccines, checkups, Deslorelin implants, insulinoma medication) -litter/potty pads This will be such an amazing resource for others! Thank you!!!(Feed generated with FetchRSS)
